headline: Oracle Names Stephen Rusckowski to the Board of Directors
summary: Oracle Corporation (NYSE: ORCL) today announced that it unanimously elected Stephen Rusckowski to Oracle's Board of Directors and increased the size of the Board to 14. The election is effective as of November 18, 2025.

content.title: Oracle Names Stephen Rusckowski to the Board of Directors
content.summary: Oracle Corporation (NYSE: ORCL) today announced that it unanimously elected Stephen Rusckowski to Oracle's Board of Directors and increased the size of the Board to 14. The election is effective as of November 18, 2025.

headline: OpenAI Partner Foxconn Plans Multibillion-Dollar US AI Push
summary: Also known as Foxconn, the Taiwanese company on Friday unveiled a partnership with OpenAI on server design and production.  The two will work closely together to resolve the particular pain points of getting artificial intelligence data centers up and running over the key first few months of operation, Foxconn Chairman Young Liu said in an interview with Bloomberg Television.

headline: Analysis-Jitters over AI spending set to grow as US tech giants flood bond market ​
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Investors are growing uneasy that the rapid rise in public debt used to bankroll AI investments could strain the U.S. corporate bond market and eventually dampen the appeal of tech stocks, despite leverage across most major companies remaining low for now.  Big tech firms are turning aggressively to the debt markets in their race to build AI-ready data centers, a shift ​for Silicon Valley firms that typically relied on cash to fund their investments.  Since September, public bond issuance by four of the major cloud computing and AI platform companies known as "hyperscalers" has hit nearly $90 billion, ‌with Google owner Alphabet selling $25 billion in bonds, Meta $30 billion, Oracle $18 billion, and Amazon, the most recent, $15 billion, according to Reuters calculations of publicly available data.

content.title: Analysis-Jitters over AI spending set to grow as US tech giants flood bond market ​
content.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Investors are growing uneasy that the rapid rise in public debt used to bankroll AI investments could strain the U.S. corporate bond market and eventually dampen the appeal of tech stocks, despite leverage across most major companies remaining low for now.  Big tech firms are turning aggressively to the debt markets in their race to build AI-ready data centers, a shift ​for Silicon Valley firms that typically relied on cash to fund their investments.  Since September, public bond issuance by four of the major cloud computing and AI platform companies known as "hyperscalers" has hit nearly $90 billion, ‌with Google owner Alphabet selling $25 billion in bonds, Meta $30 billion, Oracle $18 billion, and Amazon, the most recent, $15 billion, according to Reuters calculations of publicly available data.

headline: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix submit bids for Warner Bros, source says
summary:
STORY: Warner Bros Discovery has received buyout bids from rivals Paramount Skydance, Comcast and Netflix.

That's according to a source close to the matter on Thursday (November 20).

Paramount is expected to bid for all of Warner Bros Discovery, including its cable television networks.

The move is supported by the studio's controlling shareholder, Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison, who is among the world's richest men.

The potential combination would strengthen Paramount's presence in movie theaters.

And data shows it would give the firm a 32% share of the North American theatrical market.

It could also combine its streaming service Paramount+ with HBO Max.

Reuters exclusively reported the Warner Bros Discovery board rejected a mostly cash offer of nearly $24 a share for the company, which valued it at $60 billion.

The board publicly announced it would consider strategic options for the studio.

NBCUniversal's corporate parent, Comcast, is also interested in Warner's film and television studios and HBO.

The entertainment unit has characters, including Superman and Batman, which can be used on film and at theme parks.

Netflix is also interested in Warner's.

The streaming giant aims to access Warner's large film library containing the likes of "Harry Potter" and "Lord of the Rings."

Warner Bros Discovery didn't immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

None of the parties reportedly interested in buying the firm commented either.

headline: Big Tech’s Debt Binge Raises Risk in Race to Create an AI World
summary: The enormous sums major technology companies are spending on AI are nothing new, but the record pile of debt they’re raising to do it is.  What’s worrying stock traders is the trend represents a break from recent history, when companies tapped their huge cash piles to pay for their capital expenditures.  The use of leverage and the circular nature of many of the financing deals introduces a level of risk that wasn’t there before.

content.title: Big Tech’s Debt Binge Raises Risk in Race to Create an AI World
content.summary: The enormous sums major technology companies are spending on AI are nothing new, but the record pile of debt they’re raising to do it is.  What’s worrying stock traders is the trend represents a break from recent history, when companies tapped their huge cash piles to pay for their capital expenditures.  The use of leverage and the circular nature of many of the financing deals introduces a level of risk that wasn’t there before.

headline: Oracle the ‘Oracle’? Watch the Cloud Software Stock as AI Slumps.
summary: Oracle  is a cloud-software company, now tied closely to the artificial intelligence investment trade, that may be doing the same thing.  Shares in  Oracle  have tumbled nearly 40% since early September, lopping nearly $360 billion from its market value, since the company unveiled a huge jump in projected revenue from its burgeoning AI business in early September.  Spending all that cash on AI infrastructure is, by itself, a key concern for investors worried about the financial arithmetic of the world’s hottest new technology.

headline: Bubble Trouble: AI rally shows cracks as investors question risks
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -The biggest bout of volatility in U.S. stocks in months has revealed cracks in the artificial intelligence-related rally, raising questions about whether the market has been in the grips of a speculative bubble that may be popping.  Soaring valuations in AI stocks this year have stoked worries that Wall Street may be inflating ​another speculative bubble, with some of these fears coming to the fore after a stellar earnings report from AI bellwether Nvidia failed to rally the stock and broader market.  Several high-flying AI stocks have experienced sharp pullbacks, questions are mounting about when AI investments will translate into actual profits, and concerns are growing that enthusiasm may be outpacing the technology's near-‌term capabilities.

content.title: Bubble Trouble: AI rally shows cracks as investors question risks
content.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -The biggest bout of volatility in U.S. stocks in months has revealed cracks in the artificial intelligence-related rally, raising questions about whether the market has been in the grips of a speculative bubble that may be popping.  Soaring valuations in AI stocks this year have stoked worries that Wall Street may be inflating ​another speculative bubble, with some of these fears coming to the fore after a stellar earnings report from AI bellwether Nvidia failed to rally the stock and broader market.  Several high-flying AI stocks have experienced sharp pullbacks, questions are mounting about when AI investments will translate into actual profits, and concerns are growing that enthusiasm may be outpacing the technology's near-‌term capabilities.

headline: SoftBank reports: Debt issuance, OpenAI data center investment
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman tracks Friday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Oracle (ORCL) stock is under pressure, down 30% over the last two months. SoftBank (SFTBY) has reportedly issued another $292 million in bonds, according to Bloomberg. Additionally, the Information reported that SoftBank will invest up to $3 billion in a factory for OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) data centers. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
